intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. murorum, commonly known as the mouse ear hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is often found in temperate climates. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. The subspecies murorum is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and flowering patterns compared to other Hieracium species.
